alert.note: Alert for Northern Saratoga; Southeast Warren (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 21 at 4:40PM EST until February 23 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate snow and wintry mixed precipitation possible including snow, sleet and freezing rain. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches and ice accumulations of up to one tenth of an inch possible. * WHERE...Northern Saratoga and Southeast Warren Counties. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates Wednesday night may reach 0.5 inch to 1 inch per hour.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
